thread.title: Odds on next Conservative leader as calls are made for Theresa May to resign

author: James Rodger
title: Odds on next Conservative leader as calls are made for Theresa May to resign
text:
News Odds on next Conservative leader as calls are made for Theresa May to resign The General Election exit poll said that while the Conservatives would be the largest party, it would fall short of a majority Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Britain is on course for a hung parliament - according to a sensational exit poll prediction. 
However the two earliest actual results of the election from Newcastle and Sunderland indicate that the Conservatives could still, just, win a majority. 
The exit poll said that while Theresa May’s Conservatives would be the largest party, its predicted 314 seats would leave it 12 short of an overall majority and down 17 on 2015. 
Jeremy Corbyn’s Labour would win 266 seats it said, up 34 from 2015. 
Meanwhile the Liberal Democrats are up slightly on 14 seats from eight compared to the last General Election while the SNP has seen its number of MPs reduced from 54 to 34 seats. Read More General Election 2017 North East results in full: How North East constituencies voted 
If accurate, it will mean the gamble by Prime Minister Mrs May to call a snap election to provide a strong mandate for Brexit negotiations has spectacularly failed. 
If the Tories do fail to take an overall majority, we could be heading back to the polls by the end of the year. 
But will Mrs May be leader? Some have already called on her to resign and bookmakers are already offering odds on her successor. Read More 
The odds on the next Tory leader: 
Boris Johnson - 2/1
